Player History
Drafted in 22nd round, 343rd overall pick, by Brooklyn in 2015...
Had first career hit on 6/22/2016, off Tanner Campbell (CHI)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/29/2016, off Danilo Mota (KC)...
Drove in 6 runs against Kansas City on 5/20/2017...
Injured on 8/19/2017 with a Scratched Cornea Eye, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 9/19/2017 with a Pulled Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Won Gold Glove at Shortstop in 2017...
Drove in 6 runs against Boston on 6/12/2018...
Injured on 8/16/2018 with a Strained Hip Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 7/9/2019 with a Pulled Back Muscle, out for one week...
1/31/2020: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,807,143 through salary arbitration...
Injured on 5/16/2020 with a Inflamed Thigh Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 9/19/2020 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
1/31/2021: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,907,143 through salary arbitration...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/10/2021, hitting .500 with 1 HR, 6 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/12/2021, hitting .545 with 0 HR, 6 RBI...
1/31/2022: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,907,143 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Brooklyn to Houston on 4/16/2022 (Going to HOU: SS Louis Lozada, C Luis Stansfield. Going to BRO: P Shuutarou Nampo)...
Was claimed off waivers by St. Louis (B) on 8/30/2022.
Won World Series with St. Louis (B) in 2022...
Signed as a free agent by San Francisco on 2/3/2023 to a 3-year deal worth $2,950,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/8/2023, hitting .485 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Had 25-game hitting streak snapped on 5/10/2023...
